tool_description: Simplest API to unfurl URL descriptions, titles, images, products, from all sites without being blocked.  Fast and reliable.
name: Opengraph.io
title: Opengraph.io

api_list.name: Site Lookup
api_list.description: This endpoint will retrieve Open Graph tags from a given URL. If it is not present, our API will infer it for you.

required_parameters.name: url
required_parameters.description: The URL to be fetched (e.g. https://reddit.com)

optional_parameters.name: max_cache_age
optional_parameters.description: This specifies the maximum age in milliseconds that a cached response should be. If not specified the value is set to 5 days. (5 days * 24 hours * 60 minutes * 60 seconds * 1000 ms = 432,000,000 ms)

optional_parameters.name: full_render
optional_parameters.description: This will fully render the site using a chrome browser before parsing its contents. This is especially helpful for single page applications and JS redirects. This will slow down the time it takes to get a response by around 1.5 seconds.

optional_parameters.name: cache_ok
optional_parameters.description: This will force our servers to pull a fresh version of the site being requested. By default this value is true

optional_parameters.name: accept_lang
optional_parameters.description: This specifies the request language sent when requesting the url. This is useful if you want to get the site for languages other than english. The default setting for this will return an english version of a page if it exists. Note: if you specify the value auto the api will use the same language settings of your current request.

api_list.name: Scrape
api_list.description:
Just need the raw HTML?

The Scrape Site endpoint is used to scrape the HTML of a website given its URL

optional_parameters.name: cache_ok
optional_parameters.description: This will force our servers to pull a fresh version of the site being requested. By default this value is true

optional_parameters.name: max_cache_age
optional_parameters.description: This specifies the maximum age in milliseconds that a cached response should be. If not specified the value is set to 5 days. (5 days * 24 hours * 60 minutes * 60 seconds * 1000 ms = 432,000,000 ms)

optional_parameters.name: full_render
optional_parameters.description: This will fully render the site using a chrome browser before parsing its contents. This is especially helpful for single page applications and JS redirects. This will slow down the time it takes to get a response by around 1.5 seconds.

api_list.name: Extract
api_list.description: The extract endpoint enables you to extract information from any website by providing its URL. With this endpoint, you can extract any element you need from the website, including but not limited to the title, header elements (h1 to h5), and paragraph elements (p).

optional_parameters.name: max_cache_age
optional_parameters.description: This specifies the maximum age in milliseconds that a cached response should be. If not specified the value is set to 5 days. (5 days * 24 hours * 60 minutes * 60 seconds * 1000 ms = 432,000,000 ms)

optional_parameters.name: cache_ok
optional_parameters.description: This will force our servers to pull a fresh version of the site being requested. By default this value is true

optional_parameters.name: full_render
optional_parameters.description: This will fully render the site using a chrome browser before parsing its contents. This is especially helpful for single page applications and JS redirects. This will slow down the time it takes to get a response by around 1.5 seconds.
